intro: Palicourea bullulata, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit. It is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow fruits that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. The leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
